b5.title: Where and When to Pay Attention: The Neural Systems for Directing Attention to Spatial Locations and to Time Intervals as Revealed by Both PET and fMRI
b5.reason: This is a landmark brain-imaging study in humans that reveals the brain network involved in temporal orienting of attention and compares and contrasts it with the spatial orienting network

b14.title: The auditory cortex mediates the perceptual effects of acoustic temporal expectation
b14.reason: This study demonstrates the behavioural and neural benefits of cued temporal attention in a rodent model, such as temporally selective increases in A1 firing rate for neurons coding for the incoming stimuli to enhance the representation of sounds when auditory targets are expected

b19.title: Temporal Anticipation Based on Memory
b19.reason: This recent study in humans demonstrates that long-term memories carry temporal associations that guide perception through temporally selective anticipation of target stimuli

b25.title: Attentional modulation in visual cortex depends on task timing
b25.reason: This study presents a seminal demonstration in NHPs that attentional modulation of neuronal firing rates in a visual area (V4) follows the temporal hazard rate for the occurrence of target stimuli

b39.title: Automatic Bias of Temporal Expectations following Temporally Regular Input Independently of High-level Temporal Expectation
b39.reason: This is a study in humans that offers a clear demonstration that different types of temporal structures can have dissociable impacts on perception

b87.title: Orienting Attention to an Upcoming Tactile Event Involves a Spatially and Temporally Specific Modulation of Sensorimotor Alpha- and Beta-Band Oscillations
b87.reason: This is a study in humans that shows that modulation of alpha and beta oscillations by spatial attention is dynamically upregulated and downregulated by concurrent temporal expectations

b117.title: Temporal Prediction in lieu of Periodic Stimulation
b117.reason: This study in humans suggests distinct mechanisms for behavioural facilitation by different types of predictable temporal structures and demonstrates synergistic interactions between temporal and feature-based expectations

b130.title: Reward Timing in the Primary Visual Cortex
b130.reason: This is a study in rodents that demonstrates that neurons in the primary visual cortex are sensitive to temporal expectations about non-visual food rewards

b134.title: Temporal Expectations Guide Dynamic Prioritization in Visual Working Memory through Attenuated α Oscillations
b134.reason: This recent study in humans demonstrates that temporal expectations operate within working memory, guiding temporally selective prioritization of mnemonic items when they are expected to become relevant for behaviour
